title: Kouka : I didnt get my full chance with the Egyptian national team
body_text:
Egypt international striker Ahmed Hassan Kouka believes that he didn’t have the chance to prove himself with the national team.
In April, Kouka had suffered a severe knee injury during his team’s Alanyaspor match against its counterpart Umranispor in the Turkish Premier League competition, which lead him to miss the rest of the season.
As a result, he was dropped from the Egypt squad for the June camp that faced both Guinea and South Sudan, winning both games.
The striker however would hope he get a chance to represent the Pharaohs in the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations set to take place in Ivory Coast next January.
The 30-year-old striker hadn’t made the 2022 AFCON squad nor the 2018 World Cup one, but was part of the 2017 & 2019 AFCONs.
Speaking about missing these competitions, Kouka said: “I did not get my full chance with the Egyptian national team. When you perform well and consistently with your club in Europe, you should play more with the national team.
“However, I never got two or three matches as a starter, and sometimes I feel that my exclusion from the Egyptian national team is not related to football but due to lack of media support for me.
“With the national team, we may play 6 or 7 matches in the entire season, and I only start in one of them.
“In the European season, I play 40 or 50 matches, so comparing the national team’s season with clubs is not appropriate, and I cannot prove myself when I don’t play from the start.
“I never imagined being excluded from the World Cup squad because I was present in all the matches with Cuper before the tournament, and it was an unexpected shock.
“I cannot talk about the reasons for my exclusion because if I did, people would be shocked and Cuper told me that there was someone who requested your absence.
“After the World Cup, I received very big offers from Egypt and Saudi Arabia, but I chose to join Olympiacos because it is a big club in Greece and consistently play in the UEFA Champions League,” he added.
